How to play Reggae

Back in the day, when I was a baby, my father apparently found out this trick to make me go to sleep. He would put on some reggae music, lift me up with my head against his chest and then slowly dance around the living room to the beat of the music. A guaranteed nap time success.

While my dad used reggae for itâ€™s powerful baby-calming properties, it was my mom who was the real reggae fan in our household. I donâ€™t remember how old I was exactly, but I do know that she taught me the bassline to â€˜Stir it upâ€™ from Bob Marley and the Wailers.
